name: Edgewater 2900 Series
summary: Small business edge router typically installed at customer sites for managed voice or data services.

ports.label: WAN
ports.script: On the back of the Edgewater, find the first Ethernet jack on the left labeled WAN. Confirm the cable is fully clicked in on both the router and the upstream modem.

ports.label: LAN 1
ports.script: To reseat LAN 1, unplug the second Ethernet jack from the left, wait 3 seconds, then push it back in until you hear or feel the click.

ports.label: Reset
ports.position: rear panel, small pinhole near the power port
ports.script: Only use this if directed by support. It is a small pinhole button near the power plug and requires a paperclip to press.

images.label: Rear panel with Ethernet and power

name: Yealink T54W
summary: Business IP phone commonly used in hosted voice deployments with PoE and PC pass-through ports.

ports.label: Internet
ports.position: rear panel, center, marked with network icon
ports.color: usually gray, labeled Internet or WAN
ports.script: Turn the phone around so you are looking at the underside. Find the jack labeled Internet. Make sure the cable from the wall or switch is plugged firmly into this port.

ports.label: PC
ports.position: rear panel, next to Internet port
ports.script: If a computer is chained through the phone, it should be plugged into the port labeled PC which sits beside the Internet port.

ports.label: Headset
ports.position: rear or side depending on revision
ports.color: small square jack or USB slot
ports.script: For wired headsets, locate the small headset jack or USB slot on the back or side. Gently reseat the connector until it is fully seated.

images.label: Rear panel Ethernet and headset ports
Close up of Internet and PC ports
